description.narrative: Public and private sector partnerships are established and maintained to influence business behaviour to promote respect for and support of child rights and business principles, and to leverage support for programmes.

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)

General Economic, Commercial and Labour Affairs policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Public and private sector partnerships are established and maintained to influence business behaviour to promote respect for and support of child rights and business principles, and to leverage support for programmes.

description.narrative: In 2019, UNICEF laid a solid trajectory towards the goal of increasing the capacity of public partners to ensure that they have the technical and institutional resources necessary for monitoring the commitments of private sector companies towards respecting child rights in their activities in line with the Children's Rights and Businesses Principles (CRBP). UNICEF established partnerships with the Ministry of Mines and Strategic Resources, the Ministry of Industry and Commerce and the Ministry of Tourism, as well as professional associations, chambers of commerce, private foundations and companies. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019
